title: How to Install a 72 Pin Connector Into a NES

steps.headline: Unplug the Nintendo game system and turn it over.
steps.description: You will come across six screws that you must unscrew. Make sure that you do not lose these.

steps.headline: Turn the console back over and take off the top half.
steps.description: You should have no problem when trying to take it off. Throw away any and all hair balls you see. Purchasing a can of air can remove even more dirt (highly recommended).

steps.headline: Unscrew the screws from the big square metal covering you see next.
steps.description: There will be seven of these screws. You will now notice the green motherboard of the Nintendo, along with the "toaster."

steps.headline: Unscrew all the screws that go into the toaster, the part that the game slides into.
steps.description: There are six screws, two in the front, four in the back. (of the four in the back are longer, remember they fit into the two holes closest to the front of the console)

steps.headline: Remove the two screws in the right rear corner of the console.
steps.description: Pull the motherboard up a bit and slide the toaster off, followed by the old connector. The connector should be kind of tough to get off, but it will come. Be careful though as you do not want to break anything.

steps.headline: Slide the new connector on.
steps.description: Then put everything back together. Use the steps above, just go in reverse order. Your Nintendo should now work like new. Be sure and use clean games with your new 72 pin connector so it continues to work properly!

text: Unplug the Nintendo game system and turn it over. You will come across six screws that you must unscrew. Make sure that you do not lose these. Turn the console back over and take off the top half. You should have no problem when trying to take it off. Throw away any and all hair balls you see. Purchasing a can of air can remove even more dirt (highly recommended). Unscrew the screws from the big square metal covering you see next. There will be seven of these screws. You will now notice the green motherboard of the Nintendo, along with the "toaster." Unscrew all the screws that go into the toaster, the part that the game slides into. There are six screws, two in the front, four in the back. (of the four in the back are longer, remember they fit into the two holes closest to the front of the console) Remove the two screws in the right rear corner of the console. Pull the motherboard up a bit and slide the toaster off, followed by the old connector. The connector should be kind of tough to get off, but it will come. Be careful though as you do not want to break anything. Slide the new connector on. Then put everything back together. Use the steps above, just go in reverse order. Your Nintendo should now work like new. Be sure and use clean games with your new 72 pin connector so it continues to work properly!
